identificationModule.briefTitle: Equity Using Interventions for Pain and Depression
identificationModule.officialTitle: Equity Using Interventions for Pain and Depression (EQUIPD) - Phase 2

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
This project is part of the NIH Helping to End Addiction Long-term (HEAL) initiative (https://heal.nih.gov/). This pilot randomized controlled trial (RCT) is phase 2 of a two-phase, 5-year project with the overarching goal of testing a decision aid (DA)/coaching intervention, tailored to Black patients with comorbid chronic pain and depression, to encourage use of and adherence to nonpharmacological pain treatments (NPTs).

This 2-arm pilot trial will aim to enroll up to 355 Black patients with comorbid chronic musculoskeletal pain and depression in primary care from an urban safety-net health system (Eskenazi) in order to randomize at least 304 patients. After the baseline assessment, patients randomized to the intervention will be asked to participate in 4 coaching sessions over approximately 12 weeks. Sessions will use Motivational Interviewing principles to foster openness to NPTs and self-efficacy by helping patients identify their goals and priorities, understand their NPT options, prepare them to discuss and choose options with their primary care providers (PCPs), and reinforce these choices to foster maintenance of these changes. DA contents will be integrated into these sessions, which will facilitate discussion of these options with their PCP. The first 3 sessions take place prior to the patient's next scheduled PCP visit; the final session occurs after this visit. Assessments will be conducted at baseline, 3 months (i.e., after completing the final coaching session), and 6 months.

Patients randomized to the wait-list control group will receive usual care (in addition to study assessments at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months). After completing the final assessment, they will then be given the DA and offered a 20-minute coaching session to walk them through it.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Baseline assessments are conducted prior to randomization (Baseline assessor will not know the randomization assignment).

armGroups.label: Coaching and Decision Aid
armGroups.description: Intervention group (Individual coaching sessions and Decision Aid)

interventions.name: Coaching and Decision Aid
interventions.description: Four (4) coaching sessions over approximately 12 weeks with integration of Decision Aid contents

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Interference Scale at 3 months
primaryOutcomes.description: The pain interference score averages seven ratings, 0 (does not interfere) to 10

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Interference Scale at 6 months
primaryOutcomes.description: The pain interference score averages seven ratings, 0 (does not interfere) to 10

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ)-8 at 3 months
primaryOutcomes.description: The PHQ-8 is a widely-used, validated 8-item measure of depression severity.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ)-8 at 6 months
primaryOutcomes.description: The PHQ-8 is a widely-used, validated 8-item measure of depression severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Intensity Scale at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This pain intensity scale has 4 items with ratings from 0 (no pain) to 10 (pain as bad as you can imagine).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) Intensity Scale at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This pain intensity scale has 4 items with ratings from 0 (no pain) to 10 (pain as bad as you can imagine).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)-7 at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anxiety will be measured with the 7 item GAD-7.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)-7 at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anxiety will be measured with the 7 item GAD-7.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Pain Catastrophizing Scale at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Pain Catastrophizing Scale is a 13-item scale that assesses catastrophizing-a cognitive-emotional factor that predicts poor treatment response.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Pain Catastrophizing Scale at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Pain Catastrophizing Scale is a 13-item scale that assesses catastrophizing-a cognitive-emotional factor that predicts poor treatment response.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Altarum Consumer Engagement (ACE) Measure at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient engagement will be measured with the 12-item Altarum Consumer Engagement (ACE) Measure, which has 3 subscales: 1) commitment to manage one's health, 2) informed choice, and 3) confidence to participate in treatment decisions. Items are assessed on a 5-point Likert scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Altarum Consumer Engagement (ACE) Measure at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient engagement will be measured with the 12-item Altarum Consumer Engagement (ACE) Measure, which has 3 subscales: 1) commitment to manage one's health, 2) informed choice, and 3) confidence to participate in treatment decisions. Items are assessed on a 5-point Likert scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Decisional Conflict Scale (DCS) at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Decisional conflict will be measured with the 16-item Decisional Conflict Scale that measures personal perceptions of a) uncertainty in choosing options, b) modifiable factors contributing to uncertainty, and c) effective decision making on a 5-point Likert scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Decisional Conflict Scale (DCS) at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Decisional conflict will be measured with the 16-item Decisional Conflict Scale that measures personal perceptions of a) uncertainty in choosing options, b) modifiable factors contributing to uncertainty, and c) effective decision making on a 5-point Likert scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline CollaboRATE at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Shared decision making will be measured with CollaboRATE, a 3-item measure assessing provider effort from the patient's perspective to engage in shared-decision making during a recent appointment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Pain Self-Efficacy Questionnaire (PSEQ) at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This self efficacy questionnaire, developed to assess the confidence people with ongoing pain have in performing activities while in pain, has 10 items with ratings from 0 (not at all confident) to 6 (completely confident).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Pain Self-Efficacy Questionnaire (PSEQ) at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This self efficacy questionnaire, developed to assess the confidence people with ongoing pain have in performing activities while in pain, has 10 items with ratings from 0 (not at all confident) to 6 (completely confident).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Use of Nonpharmacological and Self-Care Approaches (NSCAP) at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NSCAP asks about 9 nonpharmacological treatment (NPT) modalities and assesses details of use such as frequency, location/source of service, and patients' judgments of effectiveness. Space is also provided for other NPTs that are used but not listed. The number of modalities for which patients answer "yes" will be summed for analyses.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Use of Nonpharmacological and Self-Care Approaches (NSCAP) at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NSCAP asks about 9 nonpharmacological treatment (NPT) modalities and assesses details of use such as frequency, location/source of service, and patients' judgments of effectiveness. Space is also provided for other NPTs that are used but not listed. The number of modalities for which patients answer "yes" will be summed for analyses.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Working Alliance Inventory (WAI) Client Short Form at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Working Alliance Inventory (WAI) Client Short Form assesses patient-provider agreement on treatment goals, collaboration to achieve these goals, and degree of emotional bond (liking and trust) between patients and providers.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Working Alliance Inventory (WAI) Client Short Form at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Working Alliance Inventory (WAI) Client Short Form assesses patient-provider agreement on treatment goals, collaboration to achieve these goals, and degree of emotional bond (liking and trust) between patients and providers.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Perceived Discrimination in Healthcare Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: We will measure perceived discrimination in healthcare settings with the 7-item "Perceived Discrimination in Healthcare" Scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Coaching Satisfaction
secondaryOutcomes.description: We will measure satisfaction with the coaching sessions and coach with 2 questions using a 5-item Likert scale ranging from Very Dissatisfied to Very Satisfied.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Tobacco, Alcohol, Prescription medications, and other Substance (TAPS) measure at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Tobacco, alcohol, and drug use, as well as prescription medication misuse will be assessed using this 4-item screening tool.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Tobacco, Alcohol, Prescription medications, and other Substance (TAPS) measure at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Tobacco, alcohol, and drug use, as well as prescription medication misuse will be assessed using this 4-item screening tool.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline PROMIS Physical Function Short Form 6b at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Physical functioning will be assessed with the PROMIS Physical Function Short Form 6b which assesses universal physical functioning with a 6-item, self-report scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline PROMIS Physical Function Short Form 6b at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Physical functioning will be assessed with the PROMIS Physical Function Short Form 6b which assesses universal physical functioning with a 6-item, self-report scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Sleep Disturbance Short Form at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The PROMIS Sleep Disturbance Short Form assesses self-reported perceptions of sleep quality, sleep depth, and restoration associated with sleep using 6 items with varying 5 point Likert scales.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Sleep Disturbance Short Form at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: The PROMIS Sleep Disturbance Short Form assesses self-reported perceptions of sleep quality, sleep depth, and restoration associated with sleep using 6 items with varying 5 point Likert scales.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Sleep Duration at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a single question asking about the number of hours and minutes of actual sleep in the last month.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Sleep Duration at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a single question asking about the number of hours and minutes of actual sleep in the last month.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) at 3 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient-reported impression of change will be measured using the PGIC which is a one-item measure reflecting a patient's perception of change after the start of an intervention.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient-reported impression of change will be measured using the PGIC which is a one-item measure reflecting a patient's perception of change after the start of an intervention.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Perceived Efficacy in Patient-Physician Interactions Scale (PEPPI-5) at 3 months
otherOutcomes.description: Communication self-efficacy will be measured with this 5-item scale that measures patients' self-efficacy in obtaining medical information and getting their most important health concern discussed in a clinic visit.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Perceived Efficacy in Patient-Physician Interactions Scale (PEPPI-5) at 6 months
otherOutcomes.description: Communication self-efficacy will be measured with this 5-item scale that measures patients' self-efficacy in obtaining medical information and getting their most important health concern discussed in a clinic visit.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Eligible patients must

* have musculoskeletal pain in the low back, cervical spine, or extremities (hip, knee, shoulder) for ≥3 months,
* have at least moderate pain intensity and interference with function, defined by a score ≥4 (possible range: 0-10) on the Pain, Enjoyment of Life and General Activity scale (PEG), a 3-item measure of pain intensity, interference with enjoyment of life, and interference with general activity,
* have at least mild depression, defined as PHQ-8 score ≥5,
* identify as Black,
* have consistent access to a telephone,
* indicate openness to new pain treatments, and
* have a scheduled appointment with their PCP in the next approximate 2-4 months or be willing to schedule one

Exclusion Criteria:

Patients are excluded:

* if previously participated in Dr. Matthias' past pilot study (IRB #12885), the pilot RCT for this project (IRB #16571), or are participating as a Patient Engagement Panel member for this project (Aim 1.1),
* if the eligibility screener or medical records indicate severe medical conditions likely precluding participation (e.g. stroke in the last 6 months, hospitalized with congestive heart failure or a heart attack in the last 6 months, cancer other than skin cancer and receiving active treatment), or
* if the eligibility screener or medical records reveal (1) active suicidal ideation, or (2) severe hearing/speech or cognitive impairment.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: NIH intends to maximize the impact of HEAL Initiative-supported projects through broad and rapid data sharing. All HEAL Initiative award recipients, regardless of the amount of direct costs requested for any one year, are required to comply with the HEAL Public Access and Data Sharing Policy, which also aligns with the NIH Policy for Data Management and Sharing (https://grants.nih.gov/grants/guide/notice-files/NOT-OD-21-013.html). HEAL award recipients must following all requirements and timelines developed through the HEAL Initiative Data Ecosystem, as described in HEAL's compliance guidance (https://heal.nih.gov/data/complying-heal-data-sharing-policy).
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: At the time of publication of the primary manuscript
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Implementation of the plan will follow the HEAL Public Access and Data Sharing Policy.
